title: Mapping Pacific country spatial data
text: Quickly generating map country often easy task. However wider Pacific region many complications. simple package implements best practice storing displaying map spatial data Pacific lower barrier others make compelling analyses visualisations Pacific issues.

title: Mapping Pacific country spatial data
text: can install development version pacificmapsR GitHub :

title: Mapping Pacific country spatial data
text: shift objects oneside dateline  Changes coordinate reference system solves axis label problem
code: library(pacificmapsR) library(patchwork) ## Problem dd_old <- sf::st_read(here::here("data/2010_PHC_Kiribati_EnumArea_3832.geojson"), quiet = TRUE) plot_pr1 <- plot_ejson_map(dd_old) ## Fixed dd <- read_ejson(here::here("data/2010_PHC_Kiribati_EnumArea_3832.geojson")) plot_sol1 <- plot_ejson_map(dd) plot_pr1 + plot_sol1 +   plot_layout(nrow = 2) ## Problem dd_old <- sf::st_read(here::here("data/2007_PHC_Fiji_EnumArea_32760.geojson"), quiet = TRUE) |>       sf::st_shift_longitude() ## To shift objects on the oneside of the dateline    plot_pr2 <- plot_ejson_map(dd_old) ## Fixed dd <- read_ejson(here::here("data/2007_PHC_Fiji_EnumArea_32760.geojson")) plot_sol2 <- plot_ejson_map(dd) plot_pr2 + plot_sol2 +   plot_layout(nrow = 2)
